active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Rainbow Table Attack Prevention (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Web 008_Application Security > 001_Cryptography > Hashing and 006_Digital Signatures > Rainbow Table Attack Prevention). Use university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning scaffolding from provided layers. Core Content Integration: - Prerequisites: Build on hashing basics (one-way, unsalted vulnerability). - Key Prevention: Unique per-user salting (invalidates precomputed tables); OWASP Password Storage Cheat Sheet: bcrypt (memory-hard, cost=12+), scrypt (N=2^14+), Argon2id (time=2, memory=64MiB), PBKDF2 (310k+ iters). NIST SP 800-63-4 emphasis on computationally intensive hashing. - Concepts: Hash functions, rainbow tables (chains, reduction funcs, time-memory trade-off). - Voter Consensus: 70% approval; emphasize salting, complete OWASP, code snippets, misconceptions (rainbow vs brute-force). Learning Objectives: [Insert full learning_objectives JSON here]. Scaffolding Layers: [Insert full scaffolding_layers JSON here]. Active Learning Ties: Ensure flashcards support discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving (e.g., scenario cards). Generate exactly 28 flashcards following this schema: { "flashcard_id": 1, "front": "Question text", "back": { "answer": "Correct answer", "explanation": "Detailed explanation with OWASP/NIST refs, why distractors wrong.", "bloom_level": "remember", "scaffolding_layer": 1, "prerequisites": ["001_Cryptography_Hashing"] }, "type": "MCQ" // or cloze, short_answer, scenario } For MCQs: Front lists question + 4 shuffled options (A-D, mark correct). Distractors per protocol. Coverage: Even distribution across objectives/layers/types. Output as numbered JSON array.
